page.description: EXIT provides an alternative way to leave a loop or function construct before the NEXT, end FUNCTION, or end while statements are reached.

section.description: EXIT FOR is used to exit from a FOR loop and EXIT FUNCTION is used to exit from a FUNCTION body. See also END.

section.title: Example
section.description: This FOR loop will be exited when the maximum value ( max_val ) is exceeded.
section.example: max_val = 5 for i = 1 TO 10 if (i > max_val) then exit for end if next i trace.writeln( str(i) )
